text: The point of Nde2 is to strengthen the Knight on c3. Moreover, the Knight on e2 can easily be transferred to the attack on the Kingside
The point of Nde2 is to strengthen the Knight on c3. Moreover, the Knight on e2 can easily be transferred to the attack on the Kingside

A typical maneuver. The Bishop on g7 must be exchanged in order for White to develop his attack successfully - it is the only defender of the dark squares surrounding the King, and its long-range power can also be effective along the h8-a1 diagonal, its sights trained on the White Queenside.

Up until this point, Korchnoi and I had been playing at blitz speed. Now I played a move which I had played earlier. My opponent went into deep thought.
Up until this point, Korchnoi and I had been playing at blitz speed. Now I played a move which I had played earlier. My opponent went into deep thought.

When I analyzed 19. Rd5 during my preperations for this match, I came to the conclusion that the best counter to it was 19... R8c5. It is not strange that after 36 minutes of thought, Korchnoi came to the same conclusion - that it was necessary to ensure himself against the gradually threatening pawn storm
